definition: Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang
surname Lang
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: No wonder people are wondering whether Zhang Yimou is too spent after the Olympic Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 难怪，大家怀疑张艺谋是否在奥运后已经江郎才尽。

sentences.english: This advertiser seems to have exhausted his wits.
sentences.chinese: 这个广告人似乎是江郎才尽了。

sentences.english: The productive writer cannot produce any more works now.
sentences.chinese: 此高产作家现在已经是江郎才尽了。

sentences.english: The write's recent book shows that he is at the end of his tether.
sentences.chinese: 写的最新著作，反映了他在江郎才尽。

definition: to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
things are not as good as they used to be
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
difficult songs find few singers (idiom)/highbrow
dud movie
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: irrelevant/beside the point
